result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermel L Curry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jermel L Curry is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jermel L Curry was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jermel L Curry in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

From Atty. Patricia Padurean regarding sentence credit.  Filed in case 15CF1202.
9/2/2015: Told attorney that 105 days credit were already applied to case 12CF1202. crt
Received and Filed, Letter on behalf of the defendant.
Received and Filed, Letter on behalf of the defendant.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 36 MONTHS, consecutive to Count 1 in case 15CF1202, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 5 MONTHS in HOC as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program, OR a course in anger management.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Dion A. unless approved by court or the agent. 
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm, body armor, or gun possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Jermel L Curry in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Defendant Jermel L Curry in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNTS 1, 3, 4, AND 5
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered counts 1, 3, 4, and 5 Dismissed. 

AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form and Addendum, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Speedy Trial Demand.
filed by defense.

Attorney Patricia M. Padurean in court, defendant Jermel L Curry not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 8-12-2015 at 8:15.   mld

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Jermel L Curry not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Patricia Padurean appeared via telephonics on case 2015CF1202.  
For the reasons as stated on the record, Court allows Attorney Domask to Withdraw as Counsel on case 2015CF1900.  Attorney Domask to advise the Public Defender's Office, that Attorney Padurean will now proceed as defense counsel for both cases; 2015CF1202 and 2015CF1900.  Attorney Domask will send the discovery for case 2015CF1900 to  Attorney Padurean.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-24-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial remains calendared for 8-12-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
received and filed.   mld
from the State, received and filed.   mld
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Drug testing, breathalyzer tests and absolute sobriety.  Absolutely No Release From Home (24 hour curfew).   mld

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Jermel L Curry not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Motion To Modify Bail is heard and denied by the Court.  The Court added gps supervision as a condition of bail.   mld

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Jermel L Curry not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant currently has another case (2015CF1202), currently calendared for a Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 8-12-2015 at 8:30 am, and defense attorney assigned to that case is Patricia Padurean.  

DEMAND for Speedy Trial was entered by defense counsel on case 2015CF1900.  

Upon the motion of the State, with no objection by defense, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial:  Case 2015CF1202 and 2015CF1900.  During proceedings, the clerk was unable to get in contact with  Attorney Padurean.  The State will follow-up and try to get in contact with Attorney Padurean, to determine if she will proceed as counsel of record for both cases, and if so, Attorney Domask would agreed to withdraw as counsel of record on case 2015CF1900.  Global offer was received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 6-8-2015 at 8:30 am.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 8-12-2015 at 8:30 am.   EFFECTIVE AUGUST 3, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE ASSIGNED TO THE HON. JEFFREY WAGNER, BRANCH 38, IN ROOM 504 OF THE COURTHOUSE.   mld
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection received and filed.
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and denied by the Court.  mld

Defendant Jermel L Curry in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Jermel L Curry in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  

Defendant also has another case assigned to branch 4 (2015CF1202), that is assigned to Attorney Patricia Padurean, and calendared for a Jury Trial on 8-12-2015 at 8:30 am.  Because it will need to be determined which attorney would be assigned to the two cases, Court defers on the Motion of the State for the Consolidation of cases.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-1-2015 at 8:30 am.  Attorney Joseph Domask will contact Attorney Patricia Padurean about the Pretrial date of 6-1-2015 at 8:30 am, in Branch 4.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Jermel L Curry
Current: 2713 W Auer Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 05-01-2015)
Prior: 3357 North 2nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dion AM or her children

Defendant Jermel L Curry in court with attorney Paul J. Manley.  Defendant Jermel L Curry in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 4. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 4 & 5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
